message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: For a comparative politics study on descriptive representation, compile the share of women in the lower or single chamber of every OECD member’s national parliament at four benchmark dates: 31 Dec 1995, 31 Dec 2005, 31 Dec 2015, and 31 Dec 2024.
Exclude upper chambers. Regarding the total seats, please provide the total number of seats in the lower parliament.  If a country joined the OECD after 1995, record 'NA' for all statistics for years before membership.

Please output one Markdown table with the columns, in this exact order:
 Country | Share of Women Seats 1995(%) | Total Seats 1995 | Share of Women Seats 2005(%) | Total Seats 2005 | Share of Women Seats 2015(%) | Total Seats 2015 |  Share of Women Seats 2024(%) | Total Seats 2024 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the column without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
We need to gather data on the share of women in the lower or single chamber of each OECD member's national parliament for the specified years. This requires a detailed lookup for each country joining after 1995 and then finding the corresponding percentages and seat totals for those years. We'll start with gathering the list of OECD countries and their year of joining.
</think>

<search> list of oecd countries and their year of joining </search>

Search query: list of oecd countries and their year of joining
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.statista.com/chart/32400/members-of-the-oecd-by-year-joined/?srsltid=AfmBOoovZXQiLzMHXy5lEoXb3OAr5aGrEKVSEPo1VfR9InXglOYF4xdw):
Chart: Which Countries Are in the OECD? - Statista This chart shows the members of the OECD, by year joined.

[Doc 2](https://www.oecd.org/en/about/members-partners.html):
Members and partners - OECD The OECD's member countries and partners work on key global policy challenges to help drive and anchor reform around the world.

[Doc 3](https://www.internationales-buero.de/en/liste_der_oecd_mitgliedsstaaten_mit_beitrittsjahr.php):
OECD Member Countries - International Bureau List of OECD member countries and year of accession · Australia 1971 · Austria 1961 · Belgium 1961 · Canada 1961 · Chile 2010 · Colombia 2020 · Costa Rica 2021 · Czech ...
<search> share of women in national parliaments OECD countries </search>

Search query: share of women in national parliaments OECD countries
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.oecd.org/en/data/indicators/women-in-politics.html):
Women in politics - OECD The women in politics indicator includes data on: Women parliamentarians: the share of women in the national lower or single houses of parliament.

[Doc 2](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SG.GEN.PARL.ZS?locations=OE):
Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%) - OECD Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%) - OECD members. Monthly ranking of women in national parliaments, Inter-Parliamentary Union ...

[Doc 3](https://www.representwomen.org/oecd_chart):
Snapshot: Women's Representation in OECD Countries Women's Political Representation in the OECD-38 ; 1, Mexico · 50.20% ; 2, Costa Rica · 49.10% ; 3, Iceland · 46.00% ; 4, Australia · 46.00% ; 5, Finland · 45.50%.

Let's use these documents to compile our table.
</think>

<search> total seats in national parliaments OECD countries </search>

Search query: total seats in national parliaments OECD countries
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.ipu.org/national-parliaments):
National Parliaments - Inter-Parliamentary Union Out of 188 national parliaments in the world, 81 are bicameral (162 chambers) and 107 are unicameral, making a total of 269 chambers of parliament with some ...

[Doc 2](https://www.oecd.org/content/dam/oecd/en/publications/reports/2021/07/government-at-a-glance-2021_70df9612/1c258f55-en.pdf):
Government at a Glance 2021 | OECD It presents the most up-to-date internationally comparable data on how public administrations function and perform in OECD countries, accession countries, and ...

[Doc 3](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SG.GEN.PARL.ZS?locations=OE):
Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%) - OECD OECD members ; Australia · 38 ; Austria · 36 ; Belgium · 41 ; Canada · 31 ; Chile · 35.
